Hi!

My name is Meryem M'hamdi. I am a PhD candidate in Computer Science and a research assistant at Information Sciences Institute (ISI) in University of Southern California (USC) in Los Angeles.

I work in Natural Language Processing Group under the supervision of Prof. Jonathan May . My main research interest is to adapt cross-lingual unsupervised approaches to different downstream applications including event extraction, dependency parsing and studying their probing capabilities at large. My aim is to devise novel approaches for learning and tuning universal multilingual representations to different domains of applications and studying their generalization especially in resource setting, zero/few shot learning scenarios while being evaluated with different flavours of transfer learning.

Twitter GitHub GitHub Linkedin

2023

  • July: Presenting my poster at ACL'2023 main conference in Toronto, Canada.
  • May: Started my internship at Microsoft Bing Multimedia in Redmond.
  • March: Will be serving on the Program Committee of ACL 2023.
  • February: I passed my thesis proposal! Many thanks to my committee members: Prof. Jonathan May (chair), Prof. Aiichiro Nakano , Prof. Kallirroi Georgila , Prof. Xuezhe Ma , and Prof. Shri Narayanan for their support. I am officially a PhD candidate!

    • 2022

    • October: I have accepted an offer to join Microsoft for a summer internship!
    • June: I will be attending NAACL 2022.
    • May: I have returned to Adobe Research to work as a research scientist intern.
    • April: I am the new organizer of NL Seminar at ISI. If you would like to participate as a speaker, feel free to reach out to me.
    • January: Happy New Year! I have started this year by submitting a paper for review to ARR 2022 targetting some ACL or EMNLP conference! I am also excited to peer-review for NAACL 2022!

    2021

    • December: Our paper on X-METRA-ADA got approved for patent filing!
    • July: I have passed my Quals exam!
    • April: Will be serving on the Program Committee of EMNLP'21 and Meta-learning and Its Applications to Natural Language Processing Workshop at ACL'21 !
    • March: Excited to share that our paper with Adobe on "X-METRA-ADA: Cross-lingual Meta-Transfer learning Adaptation to Natural Language Understanding and Question Answering" got accepted to NAACL'21
    • February: Part of the organizing committee of Morocco.AI Webinar series! Join us for our first NLP webinar !
